website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if your cat prefers to scratch on carpet – otherwise the other scratching posts we reviewed have more to offer when it comes to quality and value.
pros: Offers a basic model in a lightweight design
It's covered from post to base in soft, neutral-colored carpet
cons: It's a bit flimsy, but its ability to attract cats may make up for this concern for some cat owners

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart in less than a week.
customer_reviews.text: This post was delivered on Thursday afternoon and it is already falling apart by Sunday afternoon. The pile of the carpet is well below even apartment grade. Very short pile that doesn't match the photo in the description at all. It is already letting loose from the post. This was supposed to replace an old post that my cat had for over a year and had just started falling apart. Absolute garbage. Save your money and look at anything else.
customer_reviews.author: net surfin mama

customer_reviews.title: Carpet used is very poor quality now
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying this cat scratching post for years, my 3 cats go thru scratching posts every 3 or 4 months, but it is better than the furniture. This latest scratching post carpeting was very poor quality and immediately the loops came out. The carpet they are using now has too big of a loop to use on a scratching post. I have to clean up the carpet every time one of the cats uses the post, it gets caught in their claws and I find it all over the house. They should go back to the carpet they were using in the past, a tight weave, which made them last and were a better quality scratching post.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for all carpet tall scratching posts for awhile. I found these and when they went on a particularly good sale bought two. Kitties are thrilled, they do NOT like sisal at all! Two big boys and so far they've not really managed to put much of a dent in them, though it has only been a couple of months. I was a little concerned they would tip them over having had that issue with others previously but these have stayed upright just fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Tall Enough (almost) for our BIG Cat, but not heavy enough
customer_reviews.text: PROS: + The tallest scratching post that I cound find, anywhere. + NIce size base, which helps stabilize the too light-weight post. + Lucked out and received a "neutral" color that happened to work okay + Good price (but you get what you pay for). CONS: - Too light weight for our long, tall, 25# cat to scratch. Keep wrapping sisal rope to cover the bare spots on his old carpeted post, which is a couple inches taller, as well as an inch or two wider in diameter, with a solid post (instead of a cardboard core). - Weird (and tacky) plastic cap (instead of carpet). - Cannot specify color
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Shedding is the only thing this does.....
customer_reviews.text: This started to fall apart within a week of having it. There were carpet pieces all over my house and my cats had it in their poop and vomit. Thank god it passed through their system! Cuz this post definitely isn’t worth a surgery. I’m so disappointed because I have a cat that absolutely hates sisal and refuses to scratch any post with sisal. She only likes carpet. Unfortunately, those are hard to come by these days.
customer_reviews.author: The Cameron’s

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT TIP OVER
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a post that does not tip over when my cat uses it. Shadow loves this post and he can stretch all the way to the top, too, which he loves. One drawback, though, the carpet sheds when he scratches. No problem, I just pick it up. To see my cat happy is the most important thing. I can live with carpet pieces.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality carpet used.  Do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I put the post out just yesterday and am already having to pick up pieces of carpet. I expect that to start happening after 4 months or so but definitely not after only 24 hours. Bad quality carpet used. Do NOT recommend. Even a cheaper one would be better quality or at least not such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra G

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Woodchipper’s Pole
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd. Had 1 that lasted a year. 1 8 lb cat shredded it like a wood chipper so had to scroll for ages to find this one & order him a replacement so he’d stop shredding the carpet. This time it arrived with some discoloration: black along one edge & near the top of the pole. Lost 1 star for that. The color issue hasn’t slowed my wood chipper down 1 bit. Instantly he was back tearing the pole to bits & left Mom’s rugs alone. Momma is now happy. If Momma’s happy, then everyone’s happy, including my 8 lb woodchipper.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Batman

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A scratching post my cats use!
customer_reviews.text: I have two kittens almost 4 months old and they love this thing! They refused to scratch rope, cardboard and other types of posts. But they love this one! They climb and play on it daily. I love the soft, gentle feel of the carpet that doesn’t seem to tear out when they scratch on it. It’s very tall so I don’t have to worry about them outgrowing it. It even has a hole at the top where we attached a toy, they love it! 10/10 would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Jami Sanders

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Prefer the Carpet Covered Post
customer_reviews.text: Finding a carpet covered scratching post that is at least 30" tall is becoming difficult. I was happy to have found this one and the cats LOVE it. I have not had a cat that really likes the hemp posts, but as long as they have a nice tall one that they can stretch out on and it is carpet covered, they do not use our furniture. That being said the carpet covered ones are a little messier as the carpet tufts do pull out and have to be swept up, but that's easier than replacing furniture.
customer_reviews.author: BG Adams

customer_reviews.title: weight on the base to keep it from tipping over but this pose has a pretty wide base
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it! No more scratching on the furniture! It helps to get a string and play with your kitty on the pole to get him/her used to it but once they do, they will use it all the time! I put a 20 lb. weight on the base to keep it from tipping over but this pole has a pretty wide base. I have two cats that have used this for a month now and the carpet has held up well. This is much better than the scratching posts I've had in the past. Highly recommended if your kitty is hard on your furniture or rugs. Well made and the seller has super fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Jorgan

customer_reviews.title: Not real sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particularly for my cat Max who is 17 lbs and taller than my 2 smaller cats. The problem is it isn't real sturdy/heavy so it tends to fall down when he trys to scratch his claws on it. It is carpet vs. more of rope, so not the best for working down claws either, kinda snags when he claws on it. I'll use it, and maybe it would be better for a smaller cat, can't say I would honestly recommend it. Ginger/Chicago
customer_reviews.author: Mollyd847

customer_reviews.title: My kitties LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several different cat scratchers for my five cats based on lists of "Best Of"s. This is the most recent purchase and is different from the more expensive ones we already have. The kitties LOVE this one for some reason. Be advised, there is carpet on the bottom, so if you have hardwood floors like I do, it's a constant repositioning effort. That said, maybe moving it around is part of the fun for the cats??? Anyway, they play with it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Green Thumb

customer_reviews.title: Oreo loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this on behalf of my cat , Oreo. This is his second such scratching post from Amazon--he knew it was his straight out of the box, Because he loves it so, I'm giving it a five-star rating. Because it begins to shred from the first day, I'll give it three stars for durability and value. Nonetheless, when this one is shredded beyond recognition, I'll order another--I said he loves it, didn't I?
customer_reviews.author: Joan G.

customer_reviews.title: What is the Garbage???
customer_reviews.text: What is this nonsense?? I have been ordering these once a year for a few years now, and I understand the quality can vaty... use different types of carpeting is the main difference. But what i got today is garbage. The post doesnt even screw into the base. I guess I'm supposed to just fit it in and that it. My cats will not be able to scratch their claws on this. They will pull it out of the base every time they try. I'm not keeping this garbage
customer_reviews.author: Robert Willey

customer_reviews.title: Our cat LOVES this scratching post.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this scratching post so much. She doesn't care for the posts wrapped with rope, she'd rather the carpet kind. She does scratch it up pretty good but THAT'S WHAT IT'S FOR! She loves it. She lays on it or next to it all day and she loves being able to stretch up high to scratch. We get a new one for her for Christmas every year.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Maguire

customer_reviews.title: Now I've bought two!
customer_reviews.text: These scratching posts can cost a lot of money which is really annoying. This was a pretty good price, and it is just as good as everything else I've ever had. I got my first one years and years ago and finally upgraded it to a new one. It's a good size to go next to the couch by the corner where the cat would normally claw, which I like versus the taller trees or ones that hang on the door. I think it works better when it's in the vicinity of the area that the cat has the bad habit in.
customer_reviews.author: Robby Lennon

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved scratching carpet but not sisal rope/faux fux/cardboard scratchers. No matter how many options I gave her, she'd scratch the carpeted floor. When I moved to a place with all hardwood, she started scratching at the bed blankets (gah). Got this, and she immediately scratched it. Now she gladly goes to this instead of my blankets. If you have a carpet-fiend kitty, this may be your solution!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Very unsatisfying and disappointing for the cat.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived filthy dirty as if it had been stored uncovered in a dusty dirty storage area for a very long time. I spent a great deal of time cleaning it. Once I was done my car wouldn’t use it because the top of the post is metal and there’s no way for the animal to get its claws into it. The cat just slips off. Very unsatisfying and disappointing for the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Allen A

customer_reviews.title: P.S. cat really likes the box it came in
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to reach and stretch. She hates sisal and prefers carpet. Will carpet, doorframes, sofas, and mattresses. This scratching post was one of the only options. It’s also one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle P

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: The carpet used is textured not regular carpet. Textured carpet has loose loops and it makes it too easy for the cats to pull strings loose on it and destroy it, not to mention it may hurt the cats if they eat the loose strings!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Castro

customer_reviews.title: Some cats...
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a great thing for cats that like to stretch & scratch. My former feral cat does not like to do any of those things. He prefers trees. Since cat never went near the thing or used it, I am sending this to my sister who has two wild cats who will probably tear the thing up, like they have done with similar items.
customer_reviews.author: MGS

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money on one with all-wood construction instead.
customer_reviews.text: I expected the shredding of the carpet on the post itself since, you know, cats have claws and are scratching it like they should. I did not expect that the cardboard tube the carpet is stapled too would become loose and tilt, making it unusable. It lasted about 3 months. Save your money for a scratching post that all wood construction, not one with a cardboard tube in it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This product came pre-assembled for me in a huge box. The top portion is plastic like other Amazonians have pictured, but no lose staples or anything. My cat absolutely loves this. Looooves it. Can’t say enough good about it. I have no complaints about the product.
customer_reviews.author: gingersnaps

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this and climbs to the top with his scratching. It’s much taller than I imagined and was concerned, but nope. The little house panther loves it. He runs around and then goes wild on it. We laid it on its side and it was like a whole new post for him. Spend the money and get it. Your cat won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My cat only likes carpet scratchers, which are not as easy to find as other types. This scratcher is enormous and she loved it. All carpet scratching posts have pretty short lives because carpet is pretty weak, so this is pretty much destroyed after being used heavily for about 7 months. I'm still happy to have gotten it, and the price is really good for such a gigantic scratching post.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Can be tippy, but great height.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good for my cat. He was the runt and is only 10 lbs. He can easily tip this over if his claws get long, which deters him from using it. I have the corner of it wedged under the couch on his favorite scratching corner and he uses it frequently. When I vacuum I do have to vacuum all the loose fibers he yanked out on this. After one year it still has good life left in it.
customer_reviews.author: farcow

customer_reviews.title: Good review even though so many others thought it was poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the manufacturer read all the bad reviews and upgraded the quality. We were very hesitant to order this but its description was exactly what we needed so we went ahead. We were very pleased when it came because it’s fine. Maybe if we had multiple big cats, it wouldn’t be but it does exactly what our cat needs. We did have to anchor it down but we’ve always done that even with the big cat towers. That’s something a cat really needs...to feel secure in and on the things they decide to use.
customer_reviews.author: Vala

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: The cats love the scratcher just fine. I think it could be a bit more durable, as there are already threads being pulled out and I just got it. I got it to replace one that threads were coming out everywhere, and this one seems it may have that same problem after time passes.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Scratcher and Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this cat scratcher! It is the tallest one I've owned, which my cat loves because he gets in a good stretch before he starts scratching it. My cat refuses to utilize that twine/rope scratch material, or any other material for that matter...which means there is no use in me purchasing anything but the carpet type scratcher. This is the best one I've ever purchased. I might stock up on a couple more because this type of scratcher is not easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M.

customer_reviews.title: Its a scratching post.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to review. Its a scratching post. My cat seems to like it but he also likes stealing my work pens and hiding my socks. Seems to hold up well so far in the 2 months ive had it. My cat hates the thistle and only will use the carpet scratching post.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: They Bait and Switch with this item
customer_reviews.text: I like this post, but they didn’t ship me the post in the picture! My cat really loves this post AS PICTURED, I was getting a new one for her. The one they shipped me had a plastic top, which does NOTHING for her because she likes to climb up on top and perch like a squirrel. Couldn’t do that with the post they sent — I immediately sent it back. If it was like the one pictured, it was awesome then...
customer_reviews.author: Cat the Dog Trainer

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for a tall scratching post (my cat likes to stretch out) when I found this one. Also needed one that was covered in carpet ( because the same cat won’t use sisal). This scratching post fits the bill and is very sturdy...it hasn’t been knocked over yet! Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: P. LaPlant

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good scratching post
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good scratching post. Tall and stable. My large, heavy (~18 lbs) cat is able to stretch as far up as he wants and can pull fairly hard on this post without its falling over. The post itself is made of heavy-duty cardboard tubing with a plastic cap covering the top end. Like other cut-pile scratching posts I've tried, this post has a tendency to shed individual cut fragments of yarn fairly frequently during use. Not a huge deal for an inexpensive scratching post, but it seems like it will wear out relatively quickly with heavy scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it, so I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this one because it's 100% carpeted, which is my cat's preference. He won't touch scratchers that are sisal or rope-based. He likes this one, so I'm happy with it. I do find some fibers spread around the living room each day, which is to be expected I suppose with him tearing at carpet. It's very soft, so he likes to snooze on the base sometimes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Koll Ellis

customer_reviews.title: good for stretching but not for clawing
customer_reviews.text: It was good for awhile since it's taller than most. Elle is a Maine Coon so she needed a taller post. But since it's carpet and not hemp it's was shredded quickly. So, I got her a cat tree made with hemp and it's lasting longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bridge

customer_reviews.title: Pretty magical, haha
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my kitty loves this post! I rub a catnip pen over it every now and then and he goes bananas! It definitely help with keeping him from scratching our couches, every time I catch him doing so, I tell him no and I point to the post and he just walks away from the couch and goes and scratches the post. Pretty magical, haha! We've had it for several months and it seams to be holding up pretty good, but whenever he finally destroys it we will be buying another one because it's really working great for us. I absolutely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Paula James

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, terroble cheap design!!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this post until it broke... for the 2nd time. She loves it so much I bought a replacement despite better judgement. It broke again within 3 months!! It’s hollow inside so the height plus weight and motion of the cat breaks the cardboard. Great idea, terroble cheap design!!
customer_reviews.author: Y. Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Really like the 32"
customer_reviews.text: Tall scratch posts are the best for cats because they let the cat fully stretch out vertically without having to arc their backs down. I can't find 32 inch posts at the pet stores around here so I order these. My cats love them. Unless you have kittens or very tiny cats, you shouldn't use regular-sized posts. I've ordered 6 of these so far.
customer_reviews.author: mzo

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat (16 pounds) loves this tall scratching post so she can stretch out. She's used it about a month and I see some carpet is coming out, so I don't know how long it will last. It seems well made, but came in a ginormous box!
customer_reviews.author: tonytiger7

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: My cats have never immediately went to and stuck to a scratch post without needing some guidance. This is a game changer (for my couch, that is). One note, the post that arrived was closer to a light chocolate color but that was a good surprise as my couch is just marginally darker.
customer_reviews.author: kblc5

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: The minute I put this down my kittens were all over it. Great product. Carpet easy for them to claw up to top. A bit slippery on top so I covered top with duct tape. They even sleep at the base.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it but it is CHEAPLY made and won't last.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love carpet to scratch on. But this is very very cheap carpet and it will not last long. Every time they use it, tufts of carpet come out. Very poor quality for the money. I've only had it a few months and it is pretty much shredded.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Z.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy scratching post
customer_reviews.text: My cat will only scratch on carpet and was starting to scratch on the furniture when her old scratching post outlived its usefulness. As soon as I received this scratching post she started to use it and has stopped scratching on the furniture. It is sturdy with a good size base and the carpet is of nice quality compared to other scratching posts I have seen. The post comes already assembled so all you have to do is open the box and your cat will be ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: great for a tall kitty
customer_reviews.text: My new rescue kitty is a BIG boy. I wanted something that would let him really stretch out. This works great. Scratching posts never last all that long, but we're going into the 4th month and I only have to pick up carpet bits once in a while. Not bad, and he loves it, which is all that matters anyway.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: This is a great scratching post!
customer_reviews.text: When my 2 tall cats stand up to stretch and scratch, this marvelous scratching post is the only stand alone post I've ever found that allows them to fully extend themselves. I'm really pleased with this product (I've bought 3): the post is sturdy and doesn't wobble or tip and the carpeting stands up well to claws. I highly recommend this scratching post.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it, but...
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat loves it, but we had it less that 2 days before I started having to sweep little carpet fibers up from EVERYWHERE. I can already tell it's not going to last long. She's a small cat, but it's still no match for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kay Heffley

customer_reviews.title: THEY THINK IT'S THE CATS MEOW
customer_reviews.text: The cats like the tall size so they can stretch and scratch. The leave the furniture alone when placed at the corners of the couch, and near other furniture. Get a few them and give them choices. RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: amg011

customer_reviews.title: Carpet scratching pole color beige
customer_reviews.text: The pole is so light, it stumbles to the sides. The threads fall apart like flakes. It is made of cheaper material. It might last about 50% less than the previous one. Maybe made for kittens not for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Better than similar shaped models found at stores
customer_reviews.text: I bought a scratching pole like this for my cat when he was a kitten and he loved it, scratched the heck out of hit... and then he grew bigger, so I sought to find something like his old scratching post, but bigger- and this fit the bill! He's been using this for several months and it's still holding up pretty well. When it fails, I'll definitely buy another... these posts are saving my furniture from having to be replaced!
customer_reviews.author: Josh O

customer_reviews.title: Both of my " boys " are pretty large and heavy
customer_reviews.text: The day I received the scratching post in the mail, my cats were intrigued, but ignored it. I then rubbed some catnip in. The next thing I knew, they were sinking their claws into the carpet and trying to pull the thing down. Both of my " boys " are pretty large and heavy, but they were unable to succeed in this concerted effort. I have had the post for approximately two months and most of the material is still in tact, even with the one feline grabbing and scratching it on a daily basis. I will be purchasing this item again, because no previous posts have taken this much abuse and lasted as long
customer_reviews.author: Vicki D. Engman

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves a taller scratching post and fuller stretch
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for my cat to "take to" it, but once he did, he's been enjoying a fuller stretch and lots of scratching. I just had to find the right place to put it. Great to have a taller scratching post for my athletic boy.
customer_reviews.author: No No No

customer_reviews.title: NO TIP OVER POST, GOOD CARPET
customer_reviews.text: MY CAT SEEMS TO LIKE IT AND STARTED SCRATCHING AS I TOOK IT OUT OF BOX. I LIKE THE TALLER SIZE AND SO DOES SHE. IT SAYS MADE IN U.S.A. HOWEVER, THE BASE SAYS MADE IN MEXICO, VERY CONFUSING?
customer_reviews.author: W.TEX. MAVERICK

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: My cats only use carpet like this to sharpen their claws, and sadly its getting hard to find. My cats love this scratching post, it is very sturdy and well made. It was a great price and it got to me very fast. I highly recommend this scratching post.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: This is a Tall scratching pole!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second scratching pole and my kitty cat loves it, he’s scratching it everyday and many times a day and I love it because it’s also tall and my kitty likes to stretch up high when he’s scratching the pole. This pole is the BEST!!!! My kitty LOVES IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: lavenderlady

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loved it to death.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat definitely loves this post, but a little too much. After about 3 to 4 months, one side was completely shredded, so we rotated it. Now after 7 months, it's basically completely shredded. We don't blame the post, but still, know that if your cat uses it, it will shred, leaving carpet shreds that need swept up regularly. We're trying a rope post to see if that works better over the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Kaizen Zenkai

customer_reviews.title: Durable so far.
customer_reviews.text: All three of my cats prefer it over the sisal scratching post I also have. It's holding up pretty well considering. Wish the bottom was a little heavier, but 2 of my cats are over 14 lbs. So that's probably part of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend, especially for taller/longer cats
customer_reviews.text: Both of our cats use this every day. It does shed carpet fibers the more they scratch, which gets messy, but is kind of expected. There is a place at the top where you can add a platform attachment if you want, but we left it as is. Definitely recommend, especially for taller/longer cats.
customer_reviews.author: Tabi

customer_reviews.title: The carpet used to line the posts shreds too easily. We are constantly getting out the hand vacuum ...
customer_reviews.text: The carpet used to line the posts shreds too easily. We are constantly getting out the hand vacuum to clean up the carpet bits surrounding the post. Since the carpet is so cheap, the wooden post is exposed after only a few months use. We made the mistake of buying a second one after the first one wore out. We should have bought another brand. (FYI. We have one indoor cat who uses the post.)
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Durability is OK - might last one year?
customer_reviews.text: I've had it 6 months now, and my cat LOVES this post. She practically guards it. It sheds a fair amount, but it seems durable enough. She's taken a lot of carpet off of it, but it still looks alright. I figure it will last another 6 months at most before large bare spots start to appear.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Myers

customer_reviews.title: Yes..Oh Meow!!
customer_reviews.text: This was welcomed by our two kitties! It is well built, carpet surrounds it and is sturdy. We bought our first one 3 years ago and it has been well used! Our kitties stretch all the way as they scratch and enjoy! I truly would buy again!! Our kitties thank you!!🐾🐈
customer_reviews.author: Kitty-Kat

customer_reviews.title: Durable Post
customer_reviews.text: The other carpeted scratchers we had in the past left little shreds of carpet around the house that we were constantly picking up. This one doesn’t do that. I also like that it’s a slightly grayer color than other posts and doesn’t match the carpet in our house. It’s a nice height and allows our cats to stretch as they scratch—something they can’t do on shorter posts.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Lasts one month
customer_reviews.text: You have to decide if the price is worth the one month it lasts before coming apart. I will not buy this brand again. My last one lasted over a year. This is a great size for my cats, they love it. But I'll get maybe another week out of this thing and then it will be down to the cardboard. Also, from a shipping perspective if arrived in the most ridiculously huge box with too much packing materials.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Del Sesto

customer_reviews.title: Carpeted cat scratching post
customer_reviews.text: I love the height of this carpeted cat scratching post, however, the carpet fibers are constantly being pulled out by the cats. The quality of the carpet doesn't lend itself to this purpose. Purchase it only if you plan to pick up carpet fibers frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Post
customer_reviews.text: Made well. Cat loves the scratching post. Talk enough for a good stretch. Sheds a few fibers, but that's to be expected with all the active scratching. Saves the furniture!!!
customer_reviews.author: Schmoozer

customer_reviews.title: Cat immediately scratched on the pole and it is tall ...
customer_reviews.text: Cat immediately scratched on the pole and it is tall enough for a fully grown cat to stretch completely. Only negative is the carpet used is a closed loop fiber which the cat can pull completely free from the pole. If you don't mind little carpet threads all around the pole it is ok.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Alkek

customer_reviews.title: It's no longer carpet. My cat won't use it
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the same type that I normally get, it's not carpet and my cat doesn't want to use it. What a waste of money. I'm not happy and neither is my cat. What can be done to fix this?
customer_reviews.author: Hitman

customer_reviews.title: The only post that's tall enough, but about that quality...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second or third purchase of a North American Pet scratch post, and unfortunately, each subsequent purchase seems a bit flimsier. The base seems just a touch smaller and lighter in weight and the carpet seems shorter and less dense. Still, it's the only carpeted (my cat doesn't like sisal) scratch post I can find that's tall enough for my cat to stretch out on and he's using it regularly. It rates four stars for being the only product that fits the bill, but falls short of five stars due to the somewhat declining quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in the past. Something happened to the quality!!! top beam loosely fitted into bottom fals over and is super unstable. Poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: camilla mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves it
customer_reviews.text: He just lays on it and purrs! Our cat is huge (like 20 lbs and 3 ft long with tail) and this post is the perfect size for him. Tall and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Hill

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the 32" and they immediately took to it and love it. They stretch out and kind of hang ...
customer_reviews.text: My two cats prefer carpet scratching posts over any other kind. I ordered the 32" and they immediately took to it and love it. They stretch out and kind of hang on it while scratching. It's also pretty stable. They're doing pretty good damage to it so I don't expect it to look pretty 6 months from now, but that's just the way carpet scratchers normally hold up.
customer_reviews.author: T.P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems different from prior models
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in the past and my cats love it, but this scratching post I received in July 2017 seems to be of a different quality. The carpet is shedding and has been for a couple of weeks. I'm having to pick up a lot of pieces throughout the house. I know sometimes new carpet sheds, but it has never been the way this one is now. Not sure if I would use the same brand next time I replace it for my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for taller "kids"
customer_reviews.text: I feel that typical cat posts are made for kittens. My cats aren't that tall, certainly not as tall as mine coons but scratching posts are too short for my "kids". This taller post is great and my cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Boiling Springs, SC

customer_reviews.title: Tall enough for bigger cats!
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat who only likes carpet scratching posts. If he doesn't have a carpeted scratching post he uses furniture and area rugs. :/ It has been difficult to find a nice tall carpeted post, and I am so glad I found this! It has a good base and doesn't tip or wobble. Saved my furniture and rugs!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M.

customer_reviews.title: Also it looked like the box was drug behind the truck a mile ...
customer_reviews.text: The price reflects the quality. The carpet is real thin and frays out thick. Also it looked like the box was drug behind the truck a mile or two before delivery. Its also really light, so that might be a problem for a heavier cat, but our cat is pretty small though so it works fine. I would purchase again but also look at a nicer quality unit before checking out.
customer_reviews.author: jason p.

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I couldnt be happier with this scratch post. My cat will only use carpet posts and I was searching for a durable post after my cat had an incident with the old one. This one is PERFECT. It doesnt shed as much and more importantly it doesnt expose plastic strands as he scratches.
customer_reviews.author: a.king

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Only Likes Carpeted Scratching Posts
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these posts that I have bought from Amazon. My cat prefers carpet to the sisal covered scratching posts that are very popular, so I was happy to find this! It's sturdy and not too short (she's a big cat).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy It
customer_reviews.text: This item turns out to be nothing like picture. It’s flimsy, the carpet sheds with the first use, and it’s unstable. You’ll be inhappy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Magyera

customer_reviews.title: Great carpet scratch pole! totally worth the wait.
customer_reviews.text: It took this pole about 3 weeks to arrive. The quality of the pole is sturdy and it doesn't fall on my 9 lbs cat. Well build and the whole thing is covered by carpet material which my cat really likes. I appreciate the packaging effort. There was no damage to it but it's a huge package like a small fridge. My kitty has been loving it since it arrives. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Jazminmom

customer_reviews.title: sheds fibers constantly
customer_reviews.text: Cat only scratches carpet, so my options are limited. However, fiber flies every time she uses it. Shoddy quality. I do not plan to repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Inky

customer_reviews.title: Great tall carpeted scratching post!
customer_reviews.text: Tall scratching posts with carpet instead of sisal are hard to find. This one is both very tall & covered with good quality carpet. Very durable. I have 3 cats who use it all the time and it's holding up nicely. Very sturdy with a big base and a big circumference post. I highly recommend this post if you have cats that only like carpeted posts to scratch, and you want a tall one so they can really stretch to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: TMS

customer_reviews.title: Human & Kitty Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 32” scratching post for my cat and everyone is happy with the purchase. It’s tall enough to allow her to stretch and the best part is that she can’t flip it over given the large base. Since I bought this, kitty no longer scratches the furniture so everyone is happy. I will definitely be a repeat customer!
customer_reviews.author: orbrexx

customer_reviews.title: Awesomely Huge
customer_reviews.text: I knew this thing was big. I didn't realize it was this big. My cat is long, so I'm happy. He likes it already. Justice is a showman. Obviously this product is on the left, and Justice's old scratching post is on the right. It is on the heavier side (naturally) and he hasn't tipped it over yet. Will update with how it holds up. I tested its pole-base connection by trying to bend it.. it's on there pretty tight.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Great post to cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this scratching post. Stretches up full length to sharpen her claws. Spray it with cat nip and she gets very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L. Strittmater

customer_reviews.title: The cat is going crazy for this. He absolutely ...
customer_reviews.text: The cat is going crazy for this. He absolutely loves it and has been very thankful since I brought it in the house. He even curled up in a ball around it. Carpet seems to be very plush and I figure if it lasts 3 months then this is money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my cat wanted, and needed!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the traditional carpet scratching post. This is perfect! Even has a spot on the top for her toys on a stick. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: I was glad to find it on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes this style of scratching post. He will not use the rope kind. I was glad to find it on Amazon. It is messy when the carpet strands are ripped out by claws but it is better than the alternative, the couch.
customer_reviews.author: B. Petereson

customer_reviews.title: They love it! They went crazy when I took it ...
customer_reviews.text: Switched back to a carpet post since my cats started clawing at the floor. They love it! They went crazy when I took it out of the box and occasionally fight over it. I think I'll probably have to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Golightly

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I was able to assembly this so fast the cats barely had time to sniff the box. It does seem to shed a bit of carpet, but new carpeting in a home does the same thing. My only complaint is about my cats, not the product--they scatched the real carpet next to the stand! Silly cats! The post is worth the purchase but training is priceless. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Lane Schilmoeller

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for a large cat
customer_reviews.text: The carpet is a bit thin, but my lion kitty still loves it. Our other post lasted 11 years.. (thicker carpet). We will see how long this one will last.. guessing maybe a year...?? It was hard finding a tall post. My cat is huge and couldn't be bothered with a shorter one. Has a little hole on top of post to put a stick with bungie string and a little bird on it filled with a catnip. haha fun to watch him!!
customer_reviews.author: s. fisher

customer_reviews.title: Walker does not like to scratch scratching posts made of other materials - ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cat carpet scratching post for several months now, and my cat loves it. Walker does not like to scratch scratching posts made of other materials - just carpet. This post is tall enough for my 14 pound cat to fully stretch out, and it is sturdy. When we move to a bigger place next year, I will get an additional one for him.
customer_reviews.author: Gail M Curran

customer_reviews.title: this is the perfect scratching post for a longer/larger cat
customer_reviews.text: this is the perfect scratching post for a longer/larger cat, it's plenty high for my maine coon mix and it's carpet. My cat HATES the rope-style scratching posts but loves this one. has a nice sized base to keep it upright also, hasn't been knocked over yet and it's standing on soft carpet.
customer_reviews.author: JayPro

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy running your vacuum daily
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy running your vacuum daily, this is the scratching post for you. With every scratch you cat makes, you'll be treated to hundreds of little carpet fibers, pulled from the post, and nicely scattered across your house. On the plus side, the cat does love it, because they are evil and like to mess with us humans
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best We've Found
customer_reviews.text: This is the best scratching post we have ever bought. It doesn't pull apart, for one thing, so we don't have carpet litter all over the floor. We also like the height - the cats can stretch up high to scratch which they seem to like..
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: My kittens love sharpening their claws on this and climbing and perching ...
customer_reviews.text: My kittens love sharpening their claws on this and climbing and perching on top. Unfortunately, the carpet fibers come loose after minimal scratching, and I have one kitten who eats anything and everything. She has tried to eat the carpet fibers that come off this. So, unfortunately I can only let them use this when I can supervise them. I was hoping for something I could just leave out that they'd have access to at all times. Maybe I'll buy some sisal rope to wind around the post to cover the carpet and see if that holds up better.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I finally found a scratching post my cats like!
customer_reviews.text: Scratching posts, it seems, are a matter of individual taste, and it took me a long time to find one my cats liked. The other perk of this post is that it is tall and my cats can get a good stretch when using it. Other posts I've tried, and believe me, I've tried many, are too small or are unstable but this one is quite sturdy. If you're having trouble encouraging your cat to use cardboard or sisal scratchers, give this one a try!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for my full grown cat. He had a home made one that was 24 inches tall. This one isnt quite as sturdy/heavy, but Ralph loves it nonetheless! And it came put together already.😃
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: but this one is his absolute favorite! I put it right beside the couch and ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is incredibly picky with cat scratchers, but this one is his absolute favorite! I put it right beside the couch and he now ignores the couch and just wants to scratch his cat scratcher. Also, the height his great because he loves to stretch and scratch and this allows him to do both.
customer_reviews.author: S. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: They Don’t Make ‘Em Like They Used To
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these over 2 years ago for my 12 lbs cat Mulligan. Got two years of good use out of it and when my boy had worn it out I was thrilled to see the same post was still available. This is what it looks like after 2 months, took 2 years to get the old one in this state. A huge disappointment and sorry they no longer make a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F. Eiben

customer_reviews.title: Good heights but sheds mercilessly!
customer_reviews.text: Have two tall cats and they love the height of this scratching post. One feline who never used a post before, can't get enough of this one. However, the carpeting used on the post sheds like crazy. I'm finding carpet lint balls all over the place. Maybe use a tighter pile on the next ones you guys produce. Otherwise, OK for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L.

product_meta.title: Classy Kitty Cat Carpet Scratching Post, Assorted Colors
product_meta.description: Style:32-InchFUN AND PLAY: The Classy Kitty Cat Post is a perfect gift for your kitten or adult cat. Provides hours of fun and excitement for your pet. Helps remove old nail sheaths from their claws, a must for keeping your pet healthy. Allows your cat or kitten to get plenty of exercise which helps tone muscles. Classy Kitty cat post gives your pet a place to play and exercise, everything your pet needs and wants. Cats Love It.
feature_bullets: The Package Length Of The Product Is 1.01 Inches
The Package Width Of The Product Is 1.01 Inches
The Package Height Of The Product Is 1.01 Inches

specifications.Manufacturer: Pet Partners dba North American Pet
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
